Name: Dodoma
Description: Located in Central Tanzania, Dodoma is the political capital of Tanzania.

Name: Arusha
Description: Arusha is a city of approximately 400,000 people in  Northeast Tanzania, East Africa. It is regarded as the gateway to the popular Northern Safari Circuit.

Name: Dar es Salaam
Description: Dar es Salaam (Haven of Peace in Arabic) was founded in 1862 by Sultan Seyyid Majid of Zanzibar on the site of the village of Mzizima. Mzizima's history dates back to when the Barawa people started to settle and cultivate the area around Mbwa Maji, Magogoni, Mjimwema, Gezaulole, and Kibonde Maji Mbagara.

Name: Kigoma
Description: Kigoma is a city in Tanzania. Beautifully situated on the shores of Lake Tanganyika. Capital of the Western Region. Main railway terminus on the shores of Lake Tanganyika. Important harbour. Population of 136,000 (2007).

Name: Mbeya
Description: Mbeya is a city in southwestern Tanzania. It is the main transit point for connections to Malawi and Zambia, and the southern access point to Lake Tanganyika.

Name: Morogoro
Description: Morogoro is a city in the Central Tanzania region of Tanzania.

Name: Moshi
Description: Moshi is a municipality in Northeast Tanzania, the mountain region of Tanzania.

Name: Mtwara
Description: Mtwara is a city in Pembwe and the Southeast region of Tanzania.

Name: Mwanza
Description: Mwanza is a city in Northwest Tanzania on the southern edge of Lake Victoria. Your main reason for coming here would likely be en route to Rwanda or Uganda. The city received some international attention after the controversial documentary Darwin's Nightmare, which is about the trade in the Nile Perch, centered in this city.

Name: Arusha National Park
Description: Arusha National Park is in Tanzania, near the city of Arusha.

Name: Mikumi National Park
Description: Mikumi National Park is in Southern-Central Tanzania.

Name: Mount Kilimanjaro
Description: Mount Kilimanjaro is an inactive strato-volcano in northeast Tanzania, near the border with Kenya. At 5,895m (19,340 feet) above sea level, Kilimanjaro is Africa's highest peak and the world's highest free-standing mountain. Aided by its relatively easy ascent - Kilimanjaro has become a major destination for mountaineers and trekkers from around the world. It's also inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List.

Name: Ngorongoro Conservation Area
Description: Ngorongoro Conservation Area is a park and UNESCO World Heritage site in the Northeast Tanzania. It contains an old volcano that has collapsed and formed a crater (caldera). The steep sides of the crater have become a natural enclosure for a wide variety of wildlife.

Name: Ruaha National Park
Description: Ruaha National Park is in Central Tanzania.

Name: Serengeti National Park
Description: Serengeti National Park is a large conservation area in the north of Tanzania. The park flows over into neighboring Kenya where it's known as the Masai Mara.

Name: Stone Town
Description: Stone Town is the main city on Zanzibar. It is a city of prominent historical and artistic importance in East Africa. Its architecture, mostly dating back to the 19th century, reflects the diverse influences underlying the Swahili culture, with a unique mixture of Moorish, Arab, Persian, Indian and European elements. For this reason, the town was added to the UNESCO World Heritage List in 2000.

Name: Tarangire National Park
Description: Tarangire National Park is in Tanzania.

Name: Udzungwa Mountains National Park
Description: Udzungwa Mountains National Park is in  Central Tanzania.
